test.name: Thunderhorse - THP8JK Construction Installation Training & Competency
test.description:
Select the best answer.
Once you begin the test you can exit however, you will have to restart from the beginning.
You may go back and change answers within the test.
Also note that to successfully pass the test you must complete the Post-Test with a score of 80% or greater.
The Pre-test can be failed as it is only used to establish a baseline score.
test.confirmationText: To confirm your test, click on the 'Next' button in the bottom right.

questionPool.name: Q1
questionPool.instructions: True or False: Nakika WI Pump Transformer VDN-6630 Transformer is to be replaced

questionPool.name: Q2
questionPool.instructions: True or False: There will be hot work permits required and fire protection required for this project

options.A: True: no work permits are reqquired for the transformer replacement
options.B: False: There are required permits for the transformer replaccement and verified during work pack walk downs

questionPool.name: Q3
questionPool.instructions: True or False: GWIS will be required to perform LO/TO's prior to any removal of equipment

options.A: True: GWIS is to perform LO/TO
options.B: False: BP Operations handles the proper LO/TO and GWIS confirms prior to construction activities

questionPool.name: Q4
questionPool.instructions: True or False: Anyone has the right to call an ALL-STOP if safety concerns are in question

options.A: True: Anyone has the right to call an ALL STOP if there is a percieved safety concern
options.B: False: Only GWIS Supervisors and BP Operations may call an All Stop during construction activies

questionPool.name: Q5
questionPool.instructions: True or False: Positive Pressure Safety Sensors are to be put in BYPASS during Construction

options.A: True: The Positive Pressure Safety Sensors will be put in BYPASS during removal and replacement activities
options.B: False: The Positive Pressure Safety Sensors will be relocated but remain ACTIVE

questionPool.name: Q6
questionPool.instructions: True or False: Glycol that is to be drained from the existing transformer must be handled with care

options.A: True: The Glycol is a toxic chemical; any questions regarding chemicals on location can be found onsite in the MDS
options.B: False: Glycol is a non-toxic chemical that is sweet in taste and safe and non-toxic for non-protected handling and the environment
